result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas J Stone

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lucas J Stone in court.  Attorney Amanda J. Olsen not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Attorney Robert Taylor checked in to appear for Attorney Amanda Olsen. Attorney Taylor did not reappear to call this case. Parties notified of new court date. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Kramer contacted the Court requesting matter set to October 24, 2022 at 9:30 am.

Defendant Lucas J Stone in court.  Attorney Amanda R. Kremer in court for Lucas J Stone.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
Defendant has completed TAD evaluation. Defense counsel requests more time to review DPA with defendant.
DPA Hearing adjourned to Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Lucas J Stone in court with attorney Amanda R. Kremer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lucas J Stone appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer. Defense requests a deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
Case adjourned.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Lucas J Stone in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lucas J Stone appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant appears in Court without counsel.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation. Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate. Court appoints Attorney Amanda Kremer who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $75.00/month beginning upon completion of the case and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
 No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lucas J Stone in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on  05/27/2022@130p
